column5: Introduction to the course: why designers should learn how to code simple things.
Learn how to write code that shows basic geometric shapes on the screen
Animate graphic primitives in order to produce generative artworks
Generate graphics using cycles, store information into variables and use random generated values and noises
Create responsive sketches, reuse blocks of code stored into functions and learn the power of objects
Pimp your sketch with external sources and generate data driven graphics
Work with data, mouse interactions and taste your sketch from your mobile and Ngrok: you'll discover a totally new flavour
Give your sketch ears and eyes and learn what are you asket to deliver by the end of the course
Give your sketch access to your device motion sensors

column4: Geolocate AKA the REAL outer space
column5: Use GPS positions and interactive maps in your sketch
The mid-term exam of the course
Combine multiple p5 sketches and canvasses on the same HTML page
